intSingularG_tria6.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /******************************************************************************
00002 * File      : intSingularG_tria6.c                                            *
00003 * Author    : Carlos Rosales Fernandez (carlos@ihpc.a-star.edu.sg)            *
00004 * Date      : 01-09-2006                                                      *
00005 * Revision  : 1.0                                                             *
00006 *******************************************************************************
00007 * DESCRIPTION                                                                 *
00008 * Computes the integral of the Green's function G when a collocation point is *
00009 * one of the nodes of the integration element and returns the values for all  *
00010 * shape functions in Int[]. Uses a regularization transformation that changes *
00011 * the triangle into a degenerated square and Gauss-Jacobi quadrature.         *
00012 * Works for quadratic interpolation in triangular elements (6-noded triangles)*
00013 ******************************************************************************/
00014 
00015 /******************************************************************************
00016 * COPYRIGHT & LICENSE INFORMATION                                             *
00017 *                                                                             *
00018 * Copyright 2006 Carlos Rosales Fernandez and The Institute of High           *
00019 * Performance Computing (A*STAR)                                              *
00020 *                                                                             *
00021 * This file is part of depSolver.                                             *
00022 *                                                                             *
00023 * depSolver is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify           *
00024 * it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by        *
00025 * the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or           *
00026 * (at your option) any later version.                                         *
00027 *                                                                             *
00028 * depSolver is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,                *
00029 * but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of              *
00030 * MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the               *
00031 * GNU General Public License for more details.                                *
00032 *                                                                             *
00033 * You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License           *
00034 * along with depSolver; if not, write to the Free Software                    *
00035 * Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA  *
00036 ******************************************************************************/
00037 
00038 #include "integral_tria6.h"
00039 
00040 int intSingularG_tria6(unsigned int SinNode, double X[6][3], double *Xeval, 
00041                        double *Int)
00042 {
00043     const unsigned int NODES_IN_ELEM = 6;
00044     unsigned int i, j, k, T;
00045     double A, B, dx, dy, dz, J, U1, U2, W1, W2;
00046     double L1[2], L2[2], N1[6], N2[6], XL[3];
00047  
00048     /* Initialize */
00049     for(i = 0; i < NODES_IN_ELEM; i++) Int[i] = 0.0;
00050 
00051     /* Choose number of subelements */
00052     if(SinNode%2 == 1){
00053         T = 1;
00054         B = 0.125;
00055     }
00056     else{
00057         T = 2;
00058         B = 0.0625;
00059     }
00060 
00061     /* Integrate using Gauss-Legendre and Gauss-Jacobi quadratures */
00062     for(i = 0; i < NGAUSS; i++){
00063         U1 = Gauss[i][0];
00064         W1 = Gauss[i][1];
00065     
00066         for(j = 0; j < NGAUSS; j++){
00067             U2 = GaussJacobi[j][0];
00068             W2 = GaussJacobi[j][1];
00069 
00070             /* Linear transformation to get the singularity at node 1 */
00071             if(SinNode == 1){
00072                 L1[0] = 0.5*(1.0 - U2);
00073                 L1[1] = 0.25*(1.0 + U1)*(1.0 + U2);
00074             }
00075             else if(SinNode == 2){
00076                 L1[0] = 0.25*(1.0 - U2);
00077                 L1[1] = 0.5 + 0.25*U1*(1.0 + U2);
00078                 L2[0] = 0.5 - 0.25*U1*(1.0 + U2);
00079                 L2[1] = 0.25*(1.0 - U2);
00080             }
00081             else if(SinNode == 3){
00082                 L1[0] = 0.25*(1.0 - U1)*(1.0 + U2);
00083                 L1[1] = 0.5*(1.0 - U2);
00084             }
00085             else if(SinNode == 4){
00086                 L1[0] = 0.25*(1.0 + U1)*(1.0 + U2);
00087                 L1[1] = 0.5 - 0.25*U1*(1.0 + U2);
00088                 L2[0] = 0.25*(1.0 - U1)*(1.0 + U2);
00089                 L2[1] = 0.25*(1.0 - U2);
00090             }
00091             else if(SinNode == 5){
00092                 L1[0] = 0.25*(1.0 + U1)*(1.0 + U2);
00093                 L1[1] = 0.25*(1.0 - U1)*(1.0 + U2);
00094             }
00095             else{
00096                 L1[0] = 0.5 + 0.25*U1*(1.0 + U2);
00097                 L1[1] = 0.25*(1.0 - U1)*(1.0 + U2);
00098                 L2[0] = 0.25*(1 - U2);
00099                 L2[1] = 0.25*(1.0 + U1)*(1.0 + U2);
00100             }
00101 
00102             /* Contribution from triangle 1 */
00103             shape_tria6(L1,N1);
00104             J = X2L_tria6(X,XL,L1,N1);
00105             dx = Xeval[0] - XL[0];
00106             dy = Xeval[1] - XL[1];
00107             dz = Xeval[2] - XL[2];
00108             A = W1*W2*J*B/sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy + dz*dz);
00109             for(k = 0; k < NODES_IN_ELEM; k++) Int[k] += A*N1[k];
00110 
00111             /* Contribution from triangle 2 (only if necessary) */
00112             if(T == 2){
00113                 shape_tria6(L2,N2);
00114                 J = X2L_tria6(X,XL,L2,N2);
00115                 dx = Xeval[0] - XL[0];
00116                 dy = Xeval[1] - XL[1];
00117                 dz = Xeval[2] - XL[2];
00118                 A = W1*W2*J*B/sqrt(dx*dx + dy*dy + dz*dz);  
00119                 for(k = 0; k < NODES_IN_ELEM; k++) Int[k] += A*N2[k];
00120             }
00121         }
00122     }
00123 
00124     return 0;
00125 }
